com.atiia.automation.sensors
Class FTVisualizationCube

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.atiia.automation.sensors.FTVisualizationCube
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class FTVisualizationCube
extends javax.swing.JPanel

The FTVisualizationCube provides a graphical display of the current forces and torques acting on a sensor by plotting the force and torque as lines in a 3-dimensional cube, the edges of which represent the maximum ratings for each of the three axes.

See Also:
Serialized Form

draw3DLine

public void draw3DLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       double dStartX,
                       double dStartY,
                       double dStartZ,
                       double dEndX,
                       double dEndY,
                       double dEndZ,
                       java.lang.String strLabel)
Draws a line and optional label in the current color between two 3-D coordinates within the cube after rotating the coordinates according to the current roll, pitch, and yaw. The x and y origin of the cube is located dead center of the drawing pane, and the z origin is placed 1.5 edgelengths behind the screen. z coordinates of +(edgelength / 2) have a z scale divider of 1.

Parameters:
g - The Graphics object to draw the line on.
dStartX - The x position to start the line at.
dStartY - The y position to start the line at.
dStartZ - The z position to start the line at.
dEndX - The x position to end the line at.
dEndY - The y position to end the line at.
dEndZ - The z position to end the line at.
strLabel - The text to place to the left of the starting position of the line.
